column2: Roles and Responsibilities: Provide trouble shooting and problem resolution assistance in areas of expertise to customers. Client interaction - collects the client requirement, understand the functionality, analyze the impact and explain to Development team. Client on-boarding making understand software functionality and features.  Remote-access and support through phone calls. Ensure customers remain satisfied with the product by educating them about functional capabilities and possible upgrades. Academic Qualification: BBA/B.Com/M.com/MBA Finance or related field Trading domain knowledge (For Retail : Knowledge of Margin and general trading terms like types of order , types of contracts etc), Knowledge of Capital Market Experience with Broker /Banks/ Financial institute/Insurance preferred. Experience: 2-7 years of relevant experience Job Location: Noida
column11: Capital Market, Fintech, Trading, Client Interaction, NIFTY, Functional Support, Financial Markets

column2: ?     Ensure full and complete understanding of trade processing end to end cycle, KYC, AML Due diligence Review tasks and keep them up-to-date, processing trades accurately within TAT     Ensure Tracking and closure of all Ageing and Outstanding items in Key MIS Reports Perform IS Signatory     Role Ensure effective On-the-job training to ensure adequate conceptual understanding within the team.     Ensure Cross-training on all accounts to reduce key man risk. Coordinate / Liaise within the team, with other departments on-shore teams. Also coordinate with share registry group to build share registries, client fund parameters and proper statement production Implement controls to eliminate operational / processing errors, and client/investor confidentiality breaches by the team Lead and supervise the team and their work effectively       Deliver (Goals)        Responses in timely manner to Investor client enquiries Completion of Audit and trades in timely manner as stated in SLA     Ensure 100% client satisfaction by eliminating negative complaints or issues brought to CRM via call report and/or client meetings.     Ensure zero confidentiality breaches Ensure zero operational errors Identify key back- ups for team members All Go Check task to be completed in timely manner Ensure to give constant written feedback on areas of improvement and remarkable performance to team members.

column2: ?         Responsible for evaluating, verifying, and processing service requests from shareholders, third-party entities, institutions, broker/dealer operations, or client Fund/Stock groups. Processes mutual fund and/or stock transactions and maintains shareholder records. Has a thorough understanding of mutual fund/stock operations. Accepts, records, processes, and troubleshoots requests from shareowners, institutions, the NSCC, the DTC, and/or broker/dealers.      Leader of professionals or first-level leaders working on issues of a diverse scope or coordinating department activities. Exercises wide-latitude to make decisions within established company policies to meet business objectives. Advises staff and partners with cross-functional teams to meet project schedules and to develop solutions to issues. Accountable for department results. Establishes procedures and recommends changes to policies. Minimally requires a Masters degree and 4 years of related experience, or Bachelors degree and 6 years of related experience, or high school degree and 8 years of related experience.

column2: Root cause analysis of exception reports during the reporting cycle in order to make required data corrections     Deep-dive analysis of cash outages, identify the accurate reason and collaborate with the appropriate stakeholder to clear the cash outage               Job competencies:              Communication:    Excellent verbal and written communication skills that are used to communicate with investors and other internal business teams         Planning and Organizing:    Gives suggestions on how to improve processes or create efficiencies; Conducts daily activities in a planned, organized fashion, and deals with change effectively and able to adapt rapidly             Experience and Skills required:          Intermediate to Expert in Microsoft Excel     Knowledge of LSAMS, SQL various Agency Applications is an added advantage

column2: Investments: You will be responsible for sourcing and assessing potential investment opportunities.      This will involve conducting research, analyzing market trends, building thesis, and evaluating startups. You will be encouraged to think critically and contribute to developing investment theses in our sectors of focus.     Portfolio: You will collaborate closely with our portfolio companies, providing guidance and support in critical areas to ensure their success.     Building Enzia: As a member of a lean team at Enzia, you will support the Enzia team with any non-investment related work such as thought leadership initiatives, internal tech integration, communications, events or finance and compliance.     While we are looking for Analysts, we are open to considering candidates with relevant experience / MBA as early Associates.
column10: Investment Banking / Venture Capital / Private Equity
column11: Compliance, Senior Analyst, Focus, Venture capital, Research, Investment

column2: Calibrate and execute outreach to Offshore Investors such as Foreign Banks,      Credit Funds, Trade Finance, Venture Debt , ECA , DFI and Multi Laterals              Originate, Drive, Execute and lead closure of transactions end to end in various      debt product categories                  Represent Indian debt markets, Yubi to various levels of the Investment hierarchy              Identify and map working processes of investors, passing intelligence back to Yubi      client teams to tailor tech product and financial proposals accordingly                  Create high-quality content towards understanding markets and positioning Yubi's      offerings.                  Build partnerships specific to markets, partnering on asset creation strategy,      product or fund raise.                  Run the marketing process for individual deals on the platform and more      holistically for the company from a capital market perspective by creating      issuer/investor artefacts, engaging in webinars, etc                  Manage existing and potential issuer relationships to increase activity on the      platform                  Partner cross-functionally with our Product, Legal and Risk teams to design      products specific to situations, understand Credit profile of clients to pitch      bespoke deals to investors - close deals and optimize tactics as it relates to capital      markets                  Assist in creating product roadmap and strategy in collaboration with other teams      like tech and product                What we are looking for                  CA / MBA, great with numbers, enterprising, ambitious                3-7 years experience in raising debt capital for corporates and financial institutions.                Understands debt markets, and associated regulation.                Ability to ideate, structure, and articulate.                Prior experience working with Offshore Banks                Ability to work in a fast-paced dynamic environment.                Ability to juggle multiple priorities while working across teams.
